text:
If you are running the server in a path that contains more than around 100 characters the unix domain socket path gets truncated (logs/cgisock.1 for example). This causes the cgid daemon to fail init. May want to use PATH_MAX for this.
A workaround is to set scriptsock a shorter path for example: /var/tmp/cgisock
creator: thelvey@accelrys.com

text:
Apparently this is a limitation of unix domain sockets on Linux (108 chars). Resolving as a dupe, or a nevermind.
